description: From post-classical Latin petrificus (13th c.), from petra (“rock, stone”).

adjectives.description: petrific (comparative more petrific, superlative most petrific)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Petrifying, turning into stone; petrifactive. [from 17th c.]
examples: “Sir!” cried Mr. Delvile, with a look meant to be nothing less than petrific.
